overall_perception_summary.headline: The Clinical Savior
overall_perception_summary.description: Aquaphor exists as the ultimate safety net for damaged skin. It strips away all vanity and emotion to function as a pure biological repair tool, positioned as the '#1 Dermatologist Recommended' solution for crisis moments (cracked skin, burns, cuts). It is the stoic Medical Authority in the bathroom cabinet—unpretentious, accessible, and scientifically infallible.

foundation.title: The Healing Authority
foundation.description: The brand is anchored in The Healer territory, deriving authority from clinical validation rather than nature. It balances a Safety First value system (preservative-free) with a mission to democratize skin repair. The positioning is pure Medical Authority—a sterile, utility-driven staple found in first aid kits rather than vanity shelves.

identity.title: Sterile Protector
identity.description: The identity is defined by distance and competence; it behaves as The Reliable Expert who doesn't need to be 'warm' to be trusted. The Caregiver archetype dominates, but expressed through the lens of a Sage (Doctor). Visually, it occupies the Pharma-Code territory—clinical white, navy blue, and urgency red signaling a sterile, hospital-grade environment.

communication.title: Clinical Problem Solver
communication.description: The messaging is strictly Rational, focusing on 'Advanced Therapy' and 'Clinically Proven' results to act as The Problem Solver for specific pathologies. The narrative is a Lab Breakthrough story, relying on the faceless authority of 'Dermatologists.' The focus is entirely on Education and Trust, proving efficacy without inspiration or fluff.

benefits.title: Biological Restoration
benefits.description: Functionally, the product acts as a Fixer, delivering Restoration to broken skin barriers. This provides the emotional payoff of Relief and Safety—the absence of pain and worry. Socially, it is The Safe Choice, a pragmatic tool that signals the user values function over form and trusts the majority consensus.

marker_1.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] ORIGIN OF AUTHORITY (The Source of Power)
marker_1.reasoning: The authority is entirely clinical—anchored by 'Petrolatum (41%)', 'Panthenol', and '#1 Dermatologist recommended' claims (Source: 1/5 Pure Clinical). The mission is not to make you glow, but to fix broken things—'cracked', 'irritated', 'minor cuts', 'burns' are the targets (Goal: 1/5 Pathology Cure). Clinical source + fixation on damage repair = The Healer.
marker_1.evidence: #1 Dermatologist recommended... Petrolatum (41%)... Advanced Therapy for cracked or irritated skin... minor cuts and burns

marker_2.reasoning: The scope is micro-focused on specific skin failures—treating a cut, a burn, or a crack (Scope: 1/5 Micro-Correction). However, the access is universal—'Suitable for the whole family' and mass-market availability signal zero barriers (Access: 5/5 Democratic). It brings medical-grade repair to the masses.
marker_2.evidence: Suitable for the whole family... minor cuts, scrapes and burns... relief chapped, dry skin

marker_3.reasoning: The brand prioritizes safety above all else—'Preservative and fragrance free', 'Safe for use on hands, lips' indicates that doing no harm is the primary value (Performance: 1/5 Hypoallergenic). Transparency is delivered through evidence claims like 'Clinically proven' and specific ingredient callouts like 'Petrolatum (41%)' (Transparency: 2/5 Evidence-First).
marker_3.evidence: Preservative and fragrance free... Clinically proven... Petrolatum (41%)... Skin protectant

marker_4.reasoning: The aesthetic is zero-emotion sterile white—it looks like it belongs in a hospital, not a spa (Aesthetic: 1/5 Clinical Sterile). The product format (7oz tube, family use) and 'Buy now' mass-market context signal utility pricing (Value: 1/5 Bulk Utility). It is positioned as a tool, not a treat.
marker_4.evidence: Sanitation-style stark-white background... #1 Dermatologist Recommended... Net Wt 7 oz... Suitable for the whole family

marker_5.reasoning: The brand temperature is cool and professional—'Advanced Therapy', 'Skin protectant' use clinical language without emotional fluff (Thermostat: 2/5 Distant). The stance is authoritative, leaning on the '#1 Dermatologist Recommended' badge to speak from a position of expertise (Power Dynamic: 4/5 Specialist). It is the serious doctor in the room.
marker_5.evidence: #1 Dermatologist recommended brand... Advanced Therapy... Skin protectant ointment... Clinically proven

marker_6.reasoning: The core drive is to protect and heal—'Protects', 'Soothes', 'Restores' are Caregiver verbs (60%). This is backed by The Sage's reliance on data—'Clinically proven', 'Dermatologist recommended' (25%). A hint of The Ruler appears in the '#1 Brand' claim (15%). Group A dominance creates The Stabilizers: bringing order to chaotic/damaged skin.
marker_6.evidence: Protects and soothes... Restores smooth, healthy skin... Clinically proven... #1 Dermatologist recommended brand

marker_7.reasoning: The tone is grave and serious—dealing with 'cuts, scrapes, burns' leaves no room for jokes (Humor: 1/5 Grave). The language is traditional and descriptive—'Protects skin from drying effects of wind' (Formality: 2/5 Traditional). Energy is non-existent; it is purely informational (Enthusiasm: 1/5 Clinical).
marker_7.evidence: Protects and soothes minor cuts, scrapes and burns... Skin protectant ointment... Preservative and fragrance free

marker_8.reasoning: The visual temperature is hospital-grade cold. Clinical white dominates, accented by navy blue and urgency red (Thermostat: 1/5 Sterile). The layout is rigid and informational, prioritizing legibility and 'first-aid' clarity over any artistic expression (Entropy: 2/5 Structured).
marker_8.evidence: Sanitation-style stark-white background... Clinical white dominates... Navy blue adds institutional strength... Red touches are minimal but surgical
marker_8.look_and_feel: Sterile Authority; a first-aid kit aesthetic designed to signal medical safety.
marker_8.distinctive_asset_2: Red rounded rectangular label reading 'Healing Ointment'
marker_8.distinctive_asset_3: Circular badge graphic with '#1 Dermatologist Recommended Brand'
marker_8.distinctive_asset_5: Large navy-blue bottom cap on white tube
marker_8.primary_palette: Clinical white background with authoritative navy text and surgical red accents.

marker_9.reasoning: The hook targets the result: 'Restores', 'Heals', 'Protects' (Hook: 4/5 Result). The persuasion is pure logic and data—'Clinically proven', '#1 Recommended', 'Petrolatum (41%)' (Persuasion: 1/5 Raw Data). It identifies a functional problem (cracked skin) and offers a proven mechanical solution.
marker_9.evidence: Clinically proven to restore... Protects and soothes... #1 Dermatologist recommended... Petrolatum (41%)

marker_10.reasoning: The story has no human face; the hero is the collective 'Dermatologist' profession (Protagonist: 1/5 The Nobel). The setting is implied to be a clinic or lab, reinforced by the stark white visual identity and 'Advanced Therapy' naming (Setting: 1/5 Sterile). Trust is built on the institution, not a person.
marker_10.evidence: #1 Dermatologist recommended... Advanced Therapy... Clinically proven... white background

marker_11.reasoning: The primary validator is the 'Circular #1 Dermatologist Recommended badge' (Validator: 1/5 The Board). The proof comes from clinical status—'Clinically proven', '41% Petrolatum' (Proof: 2/5 The Stat). It relies entirely on professional endorsement.
marker_11.evidence: #1 Dermatologist recommended brand... Clinically proven... Petrolatum (41%)

marker_12.slider_a_label: [SLIDER] THE OWNERSHIP OBJECT (What You Claim to Own)
marker_12.slider_b_label: [SLIDER] THE TARGET SCOPE (How Wide Is The Net?)
marker_12.reasoning: The brand owns a commodity formula (Petrolatum), effectively acting as the standard reference for it (Ownership: 1/5 Commodity). However, its scope is highly targeted towards specific problems—'cracked', 'dry', 'irritated', 'cuts', 'burns' (Scope: 4/5 The Problem). It wins by being the go-to specialist for damaged skin.
marker_12.evidence: Petrolatum (41%)... cracked or irritated skin... minor cuts and burns... chapped, dry skin

marker_13.reasoning: The content is educational, explaining *what* it treats (cuts, burns, cracks) (Depth: 2/5 Explainer). The intent is to prove safety and efficacy through clinical claims and dermatologist badges (Intent: 1/5 The Thesis). It feels like a medical pamphlet.
marker_13.evidence: Clinically proven... #1 Dermatologist recommended... Skin protectant ointment with Panthenol and Glycerin

marker_14.reasoning: The mechanism is active repair—it 'restores', 'heals', and fixes 'cuts and burns' (Action: 5/5 The Fixer). The outcome is biological health, not aesthetics—'restore healthy skin', 'protect from wind' (Outcome: 1/5 Biological). It reverses physical damage.
marker_14.evidence: Restores smooth, healthy skin... relieve chapped, dry skin... minor cuts, scrapes and burns

marker_15.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Panic Mode (Urgent need to stop pain/itch)
marker_15.slider_b_position_name: ▼ Sanctuary (I feel safe inside my own body)
marker_15.reasoning: The product addresses high-anxiety states: cuts, burns, and cracked skin (Anxiety: 1/5 Panic Mode). The payoff is Safety—feeling protected and 'healed' within one's own body (Self-Perception: 1/5 Sanctuary). It sells the absence of pain.
marker_15.evidence: Minor cuts, scrapes and burns... cracked or irritated skin... Protects and soothes

marker_16.slider_a_position_name: ▼ The Tool (I buy it only because it functions)
marker_16.slider_b_position_name: ▼ The Standard (What everyone uses; the default)
marker_16.reasoning: Buying Aquaphor is purely functional—it is a tool for a job (healing), not a totem of identity (Signal: 1/5 The Tool). It is 'The Standard' for this function, used by 'the whole family' and recommended by doctors (Tribal: 1/5 The Standard).
marker_16.evidence: Suitable for the whole family... Net Wt 7 oz... #1 dermatologist recommended

marker_17.slider_a_position_name: ▼ Normalization (I want to look like everyone else)
marker_17.reasoning: The social goal is Normalization—returning skin to a normal, healthy state (Social Vector: 1/5 Normalization). The tribe is The Majority—mass market, families, everyone. Choosing Aquaphor means you are making the safe, universally accepted choice (Group Dynamic: 1/5 The Majority).
marker_17.evidence: Suitable for the whole family... #1 Dermatologist recommended... Reliable brand
